args:
Alberius drives Elysium off and vows to fight
alongside Midgardsormr, so the pair forges a
pact and shapeshifts to defeat the fiends sent
by the Other. In doing so, Alberius takes a step
forward as a hero.
Did you just inflict a wound on Elysium?
Madness... The sacred sword is my very\nown pactstone; it should not possess the\nability to cause me harm.
Is that you, Midgardsormr? ...No, wait.\nThe voice is flowing out along with\nthe mana from my wound.
A torrent of manaâ€”old mana. This is not\nthe mana of the Midgardsormr before me,\nbut... No. It cannot be.

All is as you surmise: I am indeed the
Midgardsormr of seven hundred years ago,
as I was before experiencing passage
through the cycle of mana reincarnation.
But why is your mana here now?\nUnless this pactstone is...
Ah, you see the truth at last. The sacred\nblade Dragalia was wrought not from your\npactstone, Elysium...

I've been thinking, Midgardsormr.
Thanks to Ilia, the world is savedâ€”
and Elysium will not be able to touch
humanity, either.

But people will be drawn into conflict
anew with the Holywyrm, and if they
remain as they are now, they will be
utterly overwhelmed.
So I beg you, help me give them a way\nto fight. Help me leave them an arrow.

I made a promise to someone, and their
arrow took the form of switching out the
pactstone. So, tell me, Holywyrm:
How did it feel to be struck by it?
So you have reached across the span\nof 700 years to pull this trick upon me,\nMidgardsormr...
I am the light of order and cannot be\nwounded. Additionally, I have purged\nmyself of the old Midgardsormr's power.
He can do that?!\n...No, it doesn't matter. I will still fight!
Never. After all, if I surrendered now,\nI could never hope to defeat the Other.
...You would face even me\nin order to defeat the Other?
Light that knows not bending...\nHmm. It seems Chthonius's words\nfrom earlier were indeed reasonable.
Yes, it would seem he no longer desires\nto fight. Isn't that right, Elysium?
I do not, for I now recognize the strength\nof Alberius's intent to defeat the Other.
Ilia attempted to protect everything,\nand now he does the same.
Though a faith may be perverted with the\npassage of time, its creed may pass on\nwithout aberration.
Thus, perhaps, does that which humans\ncall a ï¼‚heroï¼‚ manifest in each generation.
I cannot agree with your way of doing\nthings, Elysium.
However, I understand that you, too,\nare simply trying to protect the world.
All I am is for the sake of perfection.
A perfect world, huh...\nThen just give me a little more time.
The world I create might not be the exact\none you desire, but somehow I doubt it's\nall that different.

I will not defile your world. I will defeat
the Other and make this world just a little
bit more perfect than it was before.
How's that sound?
Very well. However...I have a condition.

You must become the new rule by which
the Other is defeated. Within your short
human life, prove to me that the hero's
creed does not decay.
I swear it on my life. You will see.

(You are truly strong, Alberius.
No matter what hardships may come,
you press on without fear in order
to see your dreams made reality.)
(I wish this same strength for myself.)
...No. It's not enough to simply wish for\nsuch strength. If I want to become strong,\nI must turn my desire into action!
How could things have come to this?!\nTo think that even dragons can be\ntouched in the mind by the Other...
Everyone, please be calm. The Curia will\ntake action soon, but first we must quiet\nthe unrest in our hearts.
And how are we supposed to do that?!\nThe dragons' power is causing cataclysms\nall across the damn continent!
It is true that faith is a delicate thingâ€”\nand pray though we may, that alone\nwill not bring an end to war.
However, I want you all to try and\nremember under what umbrella we all\ngather, and why we oppose the Empire.
Why, of course the answer is that we\ndo all in Ilia's name...
Indeed we do, even though the Goddess\ndoes not stop wars or rescue us from\nthe cruel brink of death.
Yet we are thus united,\nand we have fought together.
Could we not say that such unity comes\nas the result of the Goddess's guidance?
Though we may feel lost in the darkness\nof despair, I would ask you all to take hold\nof your good sense.
If your hearts are crying out for you\nnot to give in, then we still have hope.
Though I was most disturbed by the loss of\nCardinal Lambert, things are as you say.
It is no mortal that we serve, but the\nGoddess Iliaâ€”she who has guided\nour hearts and minds all this time.
We need not wait for the Curia; what we\nneed to do was decided from the outset.
Indeed. Alberius will defeat the fiends\nall over the lands and return erelong.
Until then, we must protect our city\nfrom the fiends sent by the Other!
*pant* *pant* The dragons are out of the\nway, but there are still fiends everywhere!
We should defeat them with all haste.\nPermit me to aid you in this.
I shall fly to the city.\nAlberius, on my back.
Hngh... Is there no end to them?!
Keep a stout heart! We are the only ones\nwho can protect the... Wait! Look there!
It's a dragon, coming as the dawn!
No, this dragon has a man on his back!\nAnd not just any man...
You great fool. Your body is far too fragile\nto be leaping from the heavens like that.
Sorry for the shock. The dawn skies just\nlooked so inviting, it made me want to\nleap right into them.
As absurd as everâ€”and yet I cannot tear\nmy interest away from you.
Heh. Midgardsormr, this world is still a\nnarrow place, but I know two of us\ntogether can broaden it.
And we're going to start nowâ€”with a\nnew pact between human and dragon.
Join me and help me fight the Other!
Very well. I shall walk together with you,\nAlberius, in the new world you create.
I don't believe my own eyes...\nAlberius turned into a dragon!

We're witnessing the power that comes
from the bond between human and
dragonâ€”and a glimpse of the world
Alberius dreams of.
I must admit, you have shown me things\nthis day I never thought to see.
Now I will fight with my entire soul for the\nsake of humanityâ€”and for you, my king.
Hmm. It seems my fiends have been\nwiped out, and the otherworldly mana\nalong with them.
This Alberius now wields the power of\nthose miserable, wretched dragons.

As the shapeshifted Alberius brought down
the Other's fiends, the dawn skies over the
battlefield echoed an endless sea of voices,
each praising the hero that had come.
This, in turn, led to the events of legend known\nto all in the land: The ferocious clash with the\nOther that shook the foundation of the world.
So this is Clave Loy'elune...\nCome. The Other is waiting.
We'll destroy him and all that he is\nand put an end to thisâ€”together.

Using the secret art of the Blood Casket,
Alberius sealed Morsayati away. He then scattered
the parts of the Other's body across the land, and
shattered the holy sword Dragalia in order to seal
their evil power.
But unbeknownst to any at the time, another\nfragment of a tale fell upon a distant land...
Look there, Your Majesty. It is the evil\nthing that fell from the sky last night.
I dare say it is part of the body of the\nOther, who has been causing no small\namount of alarm among the people.

It appears a fragment of the sacred sword
stuck to it when struck, and that is now
holding back its power somehow. So then,
Your Majesty...what should we do?
If left unchecked, the Faerie Kingdom\nwill also come to be infested with fiends.\nSeal it away at once.
Still, the flesh of the Other and the sacred-\nsword fragment are massive clusters of\nmana. Perhaps they have some use...
Will this power bring calamity in the\nfuture? Or will it be a blessing?
The ages have since continued on,\nand events are once more in motion.
